name: Domain-Era Anti-Asteroid Satellites
desc: $market has its orbit dominated by an array of hundreds of thousands of domain-era exploratorium anti-asteroid satellites, presumably placed by survey drones in an attempt to increase terraforming viability. Each one is outfitted with enough weaponry to annihilate a small asteroid field, and enough armor to sustain the impact of their scattered debris. Coincidentally, these characteristics also make them excellent at destroying pre-collapse scavengers and rebels-those whom fleets composed of converted civilian ships with weak shields, unreliable targeting computers, and plentiful missiles. Their effectiveness in the current day is also quite impressive, given how few of these planets are ever explored.

name: Overgrown Nanoforge
desc: An old derelict (yet still unnervingly active) nanoforge constantly churns upon the surface of $market. It's growth safeties disabled, it will produce a significant amount of resources while continuously "spreading", with each growth providing some sort of positive and negative at the cost of a structure slot.

name: Ultramagnetic Field
desc:
$market is a scientific oddity. The convections of molten metal in the core are energetic past what should be possible, resulting in an extremely powerful magnetic field, the magnetic strength of which nearly reaches a full tesla during the storms that constantly wrack the surface.

On the surface, any loose ferromagnetic object is swiftly pulled to the ground, and any unshielded electronic quickly destroyed, rendering inhabitation a tiring prospect. However, the immense magnetic force inhibits wireless communication between vulnerable communication systems, and scrambles any sensors scanning the surface - meaning hidden weapons installations remain hidden.

name: Hyperspace Bipartisan
desc:
$market is host to a rift between dimensions, a direct link to hyperspace.

Due to the accumulation factor, as well as the unpredictable nature of hyperspace, the clouds may not always envelop the planet. Moving it would certainly isolate it from their benefits and hazards as well.

name: Pre-Collapse STC Districts
desc:
$market was once a regional hub of space traffic, evidenced by the smattering of Space Traffic Control districts atop the surface. These collections of beuracracy harbor numerous p-switched sensor arrays, gravitic interstellar mapping systems, and tachyon-based communication systems - all of which are quite hard to come by in the modern sector. Sadly, the instruments are too delicate to properly move off world, but they may be used where they sit.

Despite the rather thin traffic of the post-collapse sector, these districts can still be used to coordinate better flight paths across the system.

name: Pre-Collapse Spy Arrays
desc:
$market's atmosphere gently glimmers with the shine of countless small stealth-coated satellites (marked innocently with a "Ko Combine" sticker) observing their surroundings, corroborating their findings with sensor panels tucked away in clandestine places, and submitting heaps of raw data to a long-dead supercomputer array, nestled neatly within the planet's crust.

These sensor networks were often used in the fringe of domain space to keep an "eye" on unruly worlds, while supporting covert operations in the area. The domain never admitted their existance, and when pressed, would often talk of "surveying equipment" - nobody could disprove them, as nobody could find more than one satellite, panel, or computer at a time. 

The output of the array is completely encrypted in Domain 928-ASHHASH standard, which is considered both extremely unusual and extremely hard to crack, meaning the only decryptable datastreams (thanks to a Domain datavault breach a few cycles after the collapse) are the ones used for observation of dissidents, observation of spaceborn objects, and covert action support. Despite this, an array of this sort would surely be fairly valuable to anyone willing to use it.

name: Toteliac Habitat
desc: $market is habitat to a wild Toteliac population - highly invasive and aggressive felines, descending from the ancient african lion of legend. Titanium claws, diamond teeth, and obsidian-strength hide, coupled with an incredible sense of smell, digging instinct, and uncanny environmental adaption combine into the alpha predator of alpha predators, capable leaping 60 feet in the air to grab a shuttle, tear open its chassis, and devour the occupants, all to satisfy their massive half-carnivorous appetite.
$market is home to a "management" core, intent on optimizing network traffic of the more "important" colonies in the system via $market's own relays - to the dismay of IT workers.

name: Frontier Reinforcement Center
desc: $market is home to a sub-gamma "management" core, as well as sporadic auto-drone bays across the equator, filled to the brim with autofactories, ready to build and launch at a moments notice.

name: Magnetar Devastation
desc: $market is nigh-uninhabitable as a result of it's proximity to the nearby magnetar. The magnetic influences on the mantle cause unstable gravity, atmospheric disturbances, and spectacular volcanic eruptions that extend hundreds of kilometers above the surface until hardening into rock and continuing the doomed journey towards the star. If that wasn't bad enough, the surface is frequently slammed by pulses of highly ionized particles, rendering any speculation of a colony moot by complete lack of technological function.

name: Fractured World
desc: $market has spent innumerable years being devoured by the nearby black hole, and it is very likely that, at one point in time, it was much larger than it is now. Its mantle is exposed, and colonization is made utterly impossible by the incredibly harsh conditions.

name: Forward Operating Base
desc: $market is a temporary military installation, lacking any significant civilian or commercial presence. Security is significantly tightened, with many docking bays converted into fighter hangars and communication relays replaced by weapon installations.

name: Benefactors
desc: The IAIIC receives significant military and capital investment from external factions. As long as this remains true, the IAIIC will be a formidable force within the sector.

name: Investigations Underway
desc: $market and it's proximal space are subject to intense investigation by in-system IAIIC forces.

name: Command Disrupted
desc: The IAIIC has recently suffered a major blow to it's command structure, and is currently reorganizing at cost to it's military capabilities.

name: Disarmed
desc: $market has been disarmed due to a ceasefire treaty, severely reducing it's orbital capabilities.

name: Sabotage
desc: $market is currently reeling from an adversery's covert action.

name: Arrow Pathers
desc: $market is host to a sub-sect of pathers known as the "Arrow Of Ludd", whom will assist any construction efforts at the cost of income.

name: Crossbow of Ludd
desc: $market is the "Crossbow of Ludd", a core territory of the arrow pathers - a highly militaristic and well-funded sect of pathers. Significant effort is spent into reinforcing their territory against the demons of Moloch.

name: Diktat Infiltration
desc: $market has been infiltrated at a high level by a Diktat agent, who has "struck" a deal with the Charterist forces in-system. Umbra is to receive significant kickbacks, and Sindria is to receive 100% of Umbra's volatiles production. A rather favorable agreement to the Diktat, some would say.

name: Meson Field
desc: A highly energized field of mesons orbits this planet, amplifying the sensor range of anything within it. Useful for early warning systems.
